intro: Freziera guaramacalana, commonly known as the Guaramacalana frostflower, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Its growth is slow, and it thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species.
